<description type="note">Title: The guarding of the sepulchre.
Genre: English mystery and miracle plays.

nota Incipit hic here Ã¾e princys xal do reuerens to oure lady and gon here way and leve Ã¾e maryes at be sepulcre. Cayphas goth to Pylat seyng Ã¾us Cayphas herk sere pylat lyst to me I xal Ã¾e telle tydyngys new of o thyng we must ware be er ellys here after we myth it rewe. Ã¾ou wotyst weyl Ã¾at jhesu he seyd to us with wordys pleyn he seyd we xuld fynd it trew Ã¾e thryd day he wold ryse agey yf Ã¾at hese dyscyplys come serteyn and out of his graue stele hym away Ã¾ei wyl go preche and pleyn seyn Ã¾at he is reson Ã¾e thryd day. Ã¾is is Ã¾e cowncel Ã¾at I gyf here take men and gyf hem charge Ã¾erto to weche Ã¾e grave with gret power tyl Ã¾e thryd day be go. Pylat Sere Cayphas it xal be do for as ?e say Ã¾er is peryl in And it happend Ã¾at it were so it myth make our lawys for to blyn ?e xal se ser er Ã¾at ?e go how I xal Ã¾is mater saue And what I xal sey Ã¾er-to and what charge Ã¾ei xal haue. Come forth ?e ser Amorawnt and ser Arphaxat com ner also Ser Cosdram and ser Affraunt and here Ã¾e charge Ã¾at ?e must do Serys to Jhesu is grave ?e xal go tyl Ã¾at Ã¾e thryd day be gon and lete nother frend nor fo in no wey to towche Ã¾e ston. yf ony of hese dyscipelys come Ã¾er to fech Ã¾e body fro ?ou a-way bete hym down have ?e no fere with shamful deth do hym day in payn of ?our godys and ?our lyvys Ã¾at ?e lete hem nowth shape ?ou fro and of ?our chyldere and ?our wyfys for al ?e lese and ?e do so. ius miles Sere pylat we xal not ses we xal kepe it strong A-now. ijus miles ?a and An hunderyd put hem in pres Ã¾ei xal dey I make A vow. iijus miles And han honderyd fy on An C. and an C. Ã¾er-to Ã¾er is non of hem xal us with-stonde. iiijus miles ?a and Ã¾er com An hunderyd thowsand and mo I xal hem kylle with myn honde. Pylat wel serys Ã¾an ?our part ?e do. And to ?our charge loke ?e take hede With-owtyn wordys ony mo here Ã¾e knytys gon out of be place Wysly now Ã¾at ?e procede. lo ser cayphas how thynkyth ?ow is not Ã¾is wel browth Abowth. Cayphas in feyth ser it is sure A-now hardely haue ?e no dowth. ius Arfaxat ij let se ser amaraunt where wele ?e be wole ?e kepe Ã¾e feet or Ã¾e hed. ijus Ameraunt At Ã¾e hed so mote I the and ho so come here he is but ded. ius Arfaxat ii And I wole kepe Ã¾e feet Ã¾is tyde Ã¾ow Ã¾er come both jakke and gylle. iijus cosdram iii And I xal kepe Ã¾e ryth syde and ho so come I xal hym kylle. iiijus Affraunt 4 And I wole on Ã¾e lefte hand ben and ho so come here he xal nevyr then fful sekyrly his bane xal I ben with dyntys of dowte syr pylat Syr pylat haue good day We xal kepyn Ã¾e body in clay And we xal wakyn wele Ã¾e way and wayten all abowte Pylatus Now jentyl serys wole ?e vouch-saffe to go with me and sele Ã¾e graffe Ã¾at he ne aryse out of Ã¾e grave Ãat is now ded Cayphas We graunte wel lete us now go Whan it is selyd and kepte Also Than be we sekyr with-owtyn wo And have of hym no dred. Tunc ibunt ad sepulcrum pilatus Cayphas Annas et omnes milites et dicit Annas Loo here is wax ful redy dyght Sett on ?our sele anon ful ryght Ã¾an be ?e sekyr I ?ow plyght he xal not rysyn agayn. Pilatus On Ã¾is corner my seal xal sytt And with Ã¾is wax I sele Ã¾is pytt now dare I ley he xal nevyr flytt out of Ã¾is grave serteayn. Annas Here is more wax fful redy loo all Ã¾e cornerys ?e sele Also And with a lokke loke it too Than lete us gon oure way And lete Ã¾ese knytys abydyn Ã¾er by And yf hese dysciplys com preuyly to stele awey Ã¾is ded body to vs they hem brynge with-out delay. Pilatas On every corner now is sett my seale now is myn herte in welthe and wele This may no brybour a-wey now stele Ã¾is body from vndyr ston Now syr buschoppe I pray to the And Annas also com on with me Evyn to-gedyr all we thre hom-ward Ã¾e wey we gon. As wynde wrothe knyghtys now goht clappyd in cloth and kepyth hym well loke ?e be bolde with me for to holde ?e xul haue gold And helme of stele. Pylat Annas and cayphas go to Ã¾er skaffaldys and Ã¾e knyghtys sey Affraunt 4 Now in Ã¾is grownnde he lyeth bounde Ã¾at tholyd wounde ffor he was ffals Ã¾is lefft cornere I wyl kepe here Armyd clere bothe hed and hals. Cosdran 3 I wyl haue Ã¾is syde what so betyde If any man ryde to stele Ã¾e cors I xal hym chyde with woundys wyde Amonge hem glyde with fyne fors. Ameraunt ijus The hed I take here by to wake A stele stake I holde in honde Maystryes to make crownys I crake Schafftys to shake And Schapyn schonde. Arfaxat ius I xal not lete to kepe Ã¾e fete they ar ful w ... walterid in blood He Ã¾at wyll stalke be brook or balke hedyr to walke Ã¾o wrecchis be wood. ius miles Myn heed dullyth myn herte ffullyth of sslepp Seynt Mahownd Ã¾is bereynge grownd Ã¾ou kepp. ijus miles I sey Ã¾e same ffor Any blame I falle Mahownde whelpe Aftyr Ã¾in helpe I calle. 3us miles I am hevy as leed ffor Any dred I slepe Mahownd of myght Ã¾is ston to nyght Ã¾ou kepe. 4us miles I haue no foot to stonde on root by brynke here I Aske to go to taske A wynke.
